result.execSummary:
The defendant Torcel Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.
Conditions:
*  Pay a fine of $100.00 including all costs and surcharges by 08-29-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Obtain/maintain full time employment/school;
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status counsel in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney Robert Hampton for James Robert Daniel Rael.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with Larissa Dallman who appears under the student practice rule with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court, defendant Torcel Thomas not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  SPD intern Larissa Dallman under the student practice rules with Attorney Angel Johnson.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with Student Intern Larissa Dallman under the supervision of Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Torcel Thomas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserved Judge, Br. 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
